footnotes.english_saheeh: [1748]- In the Hereafter.  Disbelievers had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) by invoking Allāh to bring on His punishment.  See 8:32.

translations.english_saheeh: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen[1748]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall
translations.english_rwwad: A challenger asked for a punishment bound to come

translations.english_saheeh: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
translations.english_rwwad: upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,

translations.english_saheeh: [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.
translations.english_hilali_khan: From Allâh, the Lord of the ways of ascent.
translations.english_rwwad: from Allah, Lord of the pathways of ascent,

arabic_text: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
phonetic: 70.4 Ta`ruju Al-Malā'ikatu Wa Ar-Rūĥu 'Ilayhi Fī Yawmin Kāna Miqdāruhu Khamsīna 'Alfa Sanahin

translations.english_saheeh: The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The angels and the Rûh [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] ascend to Him in a Day the measure whereof is fifty thousand years.
translations.english_rwwad: by which the angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him on a Day the length of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.english_saheeh: So be patient with gracious patience.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So be patient (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), with a good patience.
translations.english_rwwad: So be patient [O Prophet] with beautiful patience.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, they see it (the torment) afar off.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they see this [punishment] far off,

translations.english_saheeh: But We see it [as] near.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But We see it (quite) near.
translations.english_rwwad: but We see it to be close at hand.

translations.english_saheeh: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,[1749]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day that the sky will be like the boiling filth of oil, (or molten copper or silver or lead).
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1750]- i.e., in the process of disintegration.

translations.english_saheeh: And the mountains will be like wool,[1750]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the mountains will be like flakes of wool.
translations.english_rwwad: and the mountains will be like dyed wool,

translations.english_saheeh: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And no friend will ask a friend (about his condition),
translations.english_rwwad: and no close friend will ask about another,

arabic_text: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ
phonetic: 70.11 Yubaşşarūnahum Yawaddu Al-Mujrimu Law Yaftadī Min `Adhābi Yawmi'idhin Bibanīhi

translations.english_saheeh: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Though they shall be made to see one another [(i.e. on the Day of Resurrection), there will be none but see his father, children and relatives, but he will neither speak to them nor will ask them for any help]. The Mujrim, (criminal, sinner, disbeliever) would desire to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children,
translations.english_rwwad: even though they will see one another. The wicked will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by offering his children,

translations.english_saheeh: And his wife and his brother
translations.english_hilali_khan: And his wife and his brother,
translations.english_rwwad: and his wife and his brother,

translations.english_saheeh: And his nearest kindred who shelter him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And his kindred who sheltered him,
translations.english_rwwad: and his kindred who stood by him,

arabic_text: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
phonetic: 70.14 Wa Man Fī Al-'Arđi Jamī`āan Thumma Yunjīhi

translations.english_saheeh: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: and everyone on earth, just to save himself.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1751]- An emphatic refusal meaning "It is not to be."

translations.english_saheeh: No![1751] Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
translations.english_hilali_khan: By no means! Verily, it will be the Fire of Hell,
translations.english_rwwad: By no means! It is a raging Flame,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1752]- This refers to the skin of the head or of the body or to the body extremities - which will be burned away.

translations.english_saheeh: A remover of exteriors.[1752]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Taking away (burning completely) the head skin!
translations.english_rwwad: that will strip off the scalps.

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.70:17) (i.e. the Hell will call out): "[O Kafir (O disbeliever in Allâh, His angels, His Books, His Messengers, Day of Resurrection and in Al-Qadar (Divine Preordainments), O Mushrik (O polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allâh).

translations.english_saheeh: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Calling[2] (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from Faith) [picking and swallowing them up from that great gathering of mankind on the Day of Resurrection just as a bird picks up a food-grain from the earth with its beak and swallows it up] (Tafsir Al-Qurtubî)
translations.english_rwwad: It will call everyone who turned their backs and disobeyed,

translations.english_saheeh: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from spending it in the Cause of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: and amassed and hoarded wealth.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, man (disbeliever) was created very impatient;
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, man was created impatient:

translations.english_saheeh: When evil touches him, impatient,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Irritable (discontented) when evil touches him;
translations.english_rwwad: when evil befalls him, he bewails,

translations.english_saheeh: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And niggardly when good touches him.
translations.english_rwwad: but when good fortune comes his way, he becomes tight-fisted –

translations.english_saheeh: Except the observers of prayer -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except those who are devoted to Salât (prayers).[3]
translations.english_rwwad: except those who pray,

translations.english_saheeh: Those who are constant in their prayer
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who remain constant in their Salât (prayers);
translations.english_rwwad: who are steadfast in their prayers;

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1753]- i.e., a specified share, meaning the obligatory zakāh.

translations.english_saheeh: And those within whose wealth is a known right[1753]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those in whose wealth there is a recognised right
translations.english_rwwad: and who give a due share of their wealth

translations.english_saheeh: For the petitioner and the deprived -
translations.english_hilali_khan: For the beggar who asks, and for the unlucky who has lost his property and wealth, (and his means of living has been straitened).
translations.english_rwwad: to the beggar and the dispossessed;

translations.english_saheeh: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense.
translations.english_rwwad: and who firmly believe in the Day of Judgment;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ
phonetic: 70.27 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Min `Adhābi Rabbihim Mushfiqūna

translations.english_saheeh: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who fear the torment of their Lord.
translations.english_rwwad: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord –

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, the torment of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure. -
translations.english_rwwad: for none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment –

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.70:29) Narrated Sahl bin Sa‘d رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Whoever can guarantee (the chastity of) what is between his two jaw-bones and what is between his two legs (i.e. his mouth, tongue and his private parts),* I guarantee Paradise for him." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 8, Hadith No.481).
* i.e., whoever protects his tongue from illegal talk like telling lies, or backbiting, etc., and his mouth from eating and drinking of forbidden illegal things, etc., and his private parts from illegal sexual acts.

translations.english_saheeh: And those who guard their private parts
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who guard their chastity (i.e. private parts from illegal sexual acts).[4]
translations.english_rwwad: and those who guard their private parts,

arabic_text: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[1754] for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except from their wives or the (women slaves) whom their right hands possess - for (then) they are not blameworthy.
translations.english_rwwad: except from their wives or bondwomen whom they own, for then they are not to be blamed.

arabic_text: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ
phonetic: 70.31 Famani Abtaghá Warā'a Dhālika Fa'ūlā'ika Humu Al-`Ādūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.70:31) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: I will narrate to you a Hadith I heard from Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم and none other than I will tell of it. I heard Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم saying, "From among the portents of the Hour are the following: Religious knowledge will be taken away; General ignorance (in religious matters) will increase; illegal sexual intercourse will prevail; Drinking of alcoholic drinks will be very common; Men will decrease in number, and women will increase in number, so much so that fifty women will be looked after by one man." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.7, Hadith No.158).

translations.english_saheeh: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
translations.english_hilali_khan: But whosoever seeks beyond that, then it is those who are trespassers.[5]
translations.english_rwwad: But whoever seeks beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.

phonetic: 70.32 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Li'mānātihim Wa `Ahdihim Rā`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who keep their trusts and covenants.
translations.english_rwwad: and those who fulfill their trusts and pledges;

translations.english_saheeh: And those who are in their testimonies upright
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who stand firm in their testimonies.
translations.english_rwwad: and who are upright in their testimonies;

translations.english_saheeh: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who guard their Salât (prayers) well.[6]
translations.english_rwwad: and who take due care of their prayers;

translations.english_saheeh: They will be in gardens,[1755] honored.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Such shall dwell in the Gardens (i.e. Paradise), honoured.
translations.english_rwwad: they will be honored in gardens.

translations.english_saheeh: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
translations.english_hilali_khan: So what is the matter with those who disbelieve that they hasten to listen from you [O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), in order to belie you and to mock at you, and at Allâh’s Book (this Qur’ân)].
translations.english_rwwad: What is the matter with the disbelievers that they are rushing towards you [O Prophet],

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1756]- They sat at a distance in order to oppose and mock the Prophet (ﷺ), claiming that they would enter Paradise before the believers.

translations.english_saheeh: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?[1756]
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Sitting) in groups on the right and on the left (of you, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)?
translations.english_rwwad: from the right and from the left, in crowds?

arabic_text: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ
phonetic: 70.38 'Ayaţma`u Kullu Amri'in Minhum 'An Yudkhala Jannata Na`īmin

translations.english_saheeh: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Does every man of them hope to enter the Paradise of Delight?
translations.english_rwwad: Does everyone of them aspire to enter a garden of bliss?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1757]- i.e., a liquid disdained.  So how can they expect to enter Paradise except by the will of their Creator?

translations.english_saheeh: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.[1757]
translations.english_hilali_khan: No, that is not like that! Verily, We have created them out of that which they know!
translations.english_rwwad: By no means! We have created them from what they know.

arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
phonetic: 70.40 Falā 'Uqsimu Birabbi Al-Mashāriqi Wa Al-Maghāribi 'Innā Laqādirūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1758]- i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), who determines the point at which the sun, moon and stars rise and set according to season and every position of observation.

translations.english_saheeh: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings[1758] that indeed We are able
translations.english_hilali_khan: So I swear by the Lord of all the [three hundred and sixty-five (365)] points of sunrise and sunset in the east and the west that surely We are Able
translations.english_rwwad: I swear by the Lord of the sunrises and sunsets that We are surely Capable

arabic_text: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ
phonetic: 70.41 `Alá 'An Nubaddila Khayrāan Minhum Wa Mā Naĥnu Bimasbūqīna

translations.english_saheeh: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To replace them by (others) better than them; and We are not to be outrun.
translations.english_rwwad: to replace them with others better than them, and none can escape Our decree.

arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 70.42 Fadharhum Yakhūđū Wa Yal`abū Ĥattá Yulāqū Yawmahumu Al-Ladhī Yū`adūna

translations.english_saheeh: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
translations.english_hilali_khan: So leave them to plunge in vain talk[1] and play about, until they meet their Day which they are promised -
translations.english_rwwad: So leave them to engage in their falsehood and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised;

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
phonetic: 70.43 Yawma Yakhrujūna Mina Al-'Ajdāthi Sirā`āan Ka'annahum 'Ilá Nuşubin Yūfiđūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1759]- i.e., just as they used to race, whenever an idol was newly appointed, to be the first of its worshippers.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.[1759]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as racing to a goal,
translations.english_rwwad: the Day when they will rush out of their graves as if they are racing towards a goal,

arabic_text: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 70.44 Khāshi`atan 'Abşāruhum Tarhaquhum Dhillatun Dhālika Al-Yawmu Al-Ladhī Kānū Yū`adūna

translations.english_saheeh: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
translations.english_hilali_khan: With their eyes lowered in fear and humility, ignominy covering them (all over)! That is the Day which they were promised!
translations.english_rwwad: with their eyes downcast and overwhelmed with disgrace. That is the Day that they were promised.
